content:
Diagnosis:
Follicular variant papillary thyroid carcinoma

Surgery:
Total thyroidectomy 15 January 2024

Histology:
Follicular variant papillary thyroid carcinoma
pT1b (1.8cm) N0M0
No lymphovascular invasion
BRAF mutation negative

Treatment:
Radioactive iodine ablation 3.7GBq completed 15 March 2024
Post-ablation scan shows no evidence of residual disease or metastases

Current medications:
Levothyroxine 125mcg daily

Current situation:
Thyroglobulin <0.1
TSH 0.3

I reviewed [redacted name] following completion of radioactive iodine ablation treatment. The post-ablation scan shows complete ablation with no evidence of residual disease or metastatic uptake. Thyroglobulin remains undetectable and TSH is appropriately suppressed on current levothyroxine dose. The patient has recovered well from both surgery and RAI treatment with no ongoing side effects.

Plan:
Continue current levothyroxine dose
Thyroid function tests and thyroglobulin monitoring in 3 months
Follow up appointment in 6 months with repeat neck ultrasound

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: Follicular variant papillary thyroid carcinoma, no lymphovascular invasion

cancer_timeline.value: Post-ablation scan shows no evidence of residual disease or metastases

patient_facts.value: Post-ablation scan shows complete ablation with no evidence of residual disease or metastatic uptake

status_updates.value: Stage I follicular variant papillary thyroid cancer treated with total thyroidectomy and radioactive iodine. Complete response to treatment with no evidence of residual disease.
Complete ablation achieved with undetectable thyroglobulin
Thyroid function tests and thyroglobulin monitoring in 3 months, repeat neck ultrasound in 6 months
